intro: Monolena lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. Monolena lanceolata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or riverbanks. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it both a popular garden plant and a potential invasive species in some areas.
